CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority

CA_CE_CONCESSIONAIRE_PROFILE.ADDRESS: Army Commercial, Building 5, Catterick Barracks, Detmolder Strasse 440

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Close Air Support Emulation and Simulation

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: Training simulators. Provision of a simulator training service to 1st Artillery Brigade. Contract duration is 2 years with 2 option years. The Joint terminal attack controllers (JTACs) do not currently have access to a Land forces specific JTAC accredited simulator that enables them to achieve their mandated currency training requirements. The contractor will be required to conduct a minimum of 424 training hours per financial year. It is anticipated that a minimum of 104 and a maximum of 140 JTACs will be trained per financial year.

The supplier will be expected to liaise with the customer to generate scenarios based on the training requirements of the unit. Specifically a supplier should be able to operate from unit generated or self-generate Special instructions (SPINS), Concept of operations (CONOPS), Concept of fires (COF), Grid related graphics (GRGs) and mapping 1: 25 000 and 1: 50 000 to replicate a simulated environment and scenarios. The customer will provide the supplier with at least 30 days’ notice when new scenarios are required.

The supplier is required to deliver the service in accordance with the training periods. The suppliers will be expected to price for each training period in addition to an hourly day rate (0800-1700) and an hourly night rate (1800-2200). The authority will use all of its minimum training hours by utilising the stipulated training periods. The authority however reserves the right to transfer hours by exception from one format to another to meet the demand. For clarity this may mean not all types of training periods will be used.

There may be requirements for the simulator to be utilised during a nominated training period in an overseas location. These are most likely to be in the USA, Estonia, Germany or the Czech Republic. This list is not exhaustive and additional costs will be negotiated by the supplier and the customer on a case-by-case basis. This requirement is expected to be by exception and not a routine requirement.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: 1) 2 x 5 Training periods. A 5 day training period will be used to support 1st Artillery Brigade JTAC concentration exercises. A 5 day training period comprises of consecutive weekdays (Mon-Fri) training from 0800-1200 Local and 1300-1700 Local. 1st Artillery Brigade may choose to utilise these 2 x 5 day training periods sequentially (i.e Monday-Friday and Monday — Friday during a 2 week period.)

2) 9 x 4 day Training periods. A 4 day training period comprising of consecutive day training. The contractor should deliver simulation training from 0800- 1200 Local and 1300-1700 Local. These training periods will be conducted during the working week (i.e Monday—Thursday or Tuesday to Friday).

3) 3 x 2 day training periods. A 2 day training period comprises of consecutive days of weekend training. These periods should be delivered on Saturday and Sundays from 0800 — 1200 Local and 1300 —1700 Local.
4) 2 X 1 night Training periods — A one night training period is a single event that should be conducted from 1800 — 2200 Local.

OPTION_DESCRIPTION.P: The supplier hereby grants to the Authority the irrevocable option to extend the contract for 2 additional 1 year periods, or any parts thereof, at the firm prices specified in their proposal and in accordance with the terms and conditions of the contract. The option(s) to extend the contract will be exercised no later than 90 days before the contract expiry date in place at the time. The option periods are expected to be as follows:

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: The authority will apply all the offences listed in Article 39(1) of Directive 2009/81/EC (implemented as Regulation 23(1) of the Defence and security public contract regulations (DSPCR) 2011 in the UK) and all of the professional misconducts listed at Article 39(2) of Directive 2009/81/EC (see also Regulation 23(2) in the DSPCR 2011) to the decision of whether a Candidate is eligible to be invited to tender.
A full list of the Regulation 23(1) and 23(2) criteria are at http://www.contracts.mod.uk/delta/project/reasonsForExclusion.html#dspr
Candidates will be required to sign a declaration confirming whether they do or do not have any of the listed criteria as part of the pre-qualification process.

Candidates who have been convicted of any of the offences under Article 39(1) are ineligible and will not be selected to bid, unless there are overriding requirements in the general interest (including defence and security factors) for doing so.
Candidates who are guilty of any of the offences, circumstances or misconduct under Article 39(2) may be excluded from being selected to bid at the discretion of the Authority.
